    Hawkesbury 2018

    Returned to the Hawkesbury River (see here for reports on previous trips) with Warren and my daughter Nicole. Last time I was there camping with Nicole was in 2009. The fishing was tough and the trip reasonably uneventful. Here are my snaps.

    Nicole and I at the campsite.

    First time I’ve seen an ice cream van at the boat ramp.

    As usual we had a boatload of gear.

    A rather harsh penalty for littering.

    First order of business was to collect some firewood.

    Nicole and I at the campsite.

    .

    Warren with a flathead.

    Warren with a bream.

    A few flathead for the table.

    Potatoes, onions and fish in foil.

    Flathead cooked in foil with lemon and onion.

    Moonrise, the evening before the full moon.

    Categories: australia, fishing, Hawkesbury River

    Updated: December 24, 2018
